# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can solve this problem in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width=10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    wrapped_str = ""
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_str)+length(word) > text_width-2 # -2 to account for space and newline character
            wrapped_str *= "\n"
        else
            wrapped_str *= " $word"
        end
    end
    return wrapped_str
end

println("Example: ")
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
@time println(wrap_string(text, 20))
```
In this code:
- We split the given string into words using `split`.
- Then we iterate over each word and add it to a new string. If adding the current word would exceed our specified width, we start a new line by appending "\n" (which adds a newline character) before adding the word.
- The time taken to run this function is also printed using `@time` macro so you can see how long it takes to execute.
